page.title: 20Electricity Sub-station
page.content: The fifteen acre site at Dunston (GR218024) which contains the sub-station is owned and run by the Central Electricity Generating Board. It is controlled automatically by a computer. The Sub_station consists of three transformers which receive power from Walpole near Kings Lynn at 400 kilovolts and transforms it to 132kv for transmission to local stations supplying Norwich and the Wymondham area. At these sub_stations it is transformed to 11kv and is hen transmitted to the homes an businesses of the area. The lines carrying the electricity are supported by large pylons which are a dominant feature of the landscape.
